apple: A round fruit with red or green skin and a whitish inside.
banana: A long, curved fruit with a yellow skin and soft, sweet, white flesh inside.
cat: A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur.
dog: A domesticated carnivorous mammal with a barking sound.
elephant: A large mammal with a trunk and tusks, native to Africa and southern Asia.
fish: A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins living in water.
grape: A small round or oval fruit used to make wine.
island: A piece of land surrounded by water.
juice: A drink made from the extraction or pressing of the natural liquid contained in fruit and vegetables.
kite: A toy consisting of a light frame with thin material stretched over it, flown in the wind at the end of a long string.
lemon: A yellow, oval citrus fruit with thick skin and fragrant, acidic juice.
monkey: A small to medium-sized primate that typically has a long tail.
notebook: A book of blank pages for writing notes.
orange: A round juicy citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind.
pencil: An instrument for writing or drawing, typically consisting of a thin stick of graphite enclosed in a long thin piece of wood or fixed in a mechanical holder.
queen: The female ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth.
rabbit: A burrowing, plant-eating mammal with long ears, long hind legs, and a short tail.
sun: The star around which the earth orbits.
tree: A woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk growing to a considerable height and bearing lateral branches at some distance from the ground.
